trustfund:
TF025415-PHRD-SHIJIAZHUANG URBAN
            TRANSPORT PROJ.(REC.-EXEC.),TF025932-PHRD-SHIJIAZHUNG URBAN
            TRANSPORT PROJ.(BANK-EXECUTED),TF030865-DANISH CTF - FY07 (DAC PART I
            COUNTRIES WITH ANNUAL PER-CAPITA GNP OF L

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Shijiazhuang (SJZ) Urban
            Transport Project for China were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: as noted, the project office (PO)
            encountered several problems in applying the agreed
            resettlement procedures and compensation rates. Some of the
            delays were the result of the city taking a more respectful
            attitude towards affected persons and taking time to
            negotiate mutually accepted solutions. The Bank welcomes
            this evolution in attitudes and therefore does not consider
            it unsatisfactory. The key performance indicators were
            focused and prima facie appropriate, but numerous. To retain
            focus and to simplify the PO's task, fewer indicators
            will have been better. The question remains, however, how to
            capture the strengthening of institutional capacity in a
            meaningful way. The issue suggests the need for a Bank-wide
            review to examine international best practice and update
            Bank guidance on indicators suitable for urban transport
            projects. This project provided a rare example of
            center-street (median) bus lanes without physical lane
            dividers. SJZ is to be commended for taking the initiative
            to experiment with this approach, as only the second city in
            China to do so. It is to be regretted that the city and
            provincial governments later opted to terminate the median
            bus lanes, without a full documentation and discussion of
            its benefits and disadvantages.
